course.subject: ACT
course.title: Capstone Project
course.catalogDescription: This course will prepare and assist students to implement a solution to a significant computing problem using project management techniques and specialized software and technologies. Students will apply their domain knowledge from computer science, IT, or another field in a timely and substantial independent project and produce significant project deliverables to begin building a professional portfolio of completed work. Beyond their own project, students will participate in a project seminar where they will benefit from the experiences of their classmates in a wide variety of applied computing projects.

objectives.objective: Understand basic concepts and procedures in managing software development and information technology projects

Gain an appreciation and basic understanding of the breadth of application areas of computer science, including software development, computational science, machine learning, and IT system development.
Be able to develop, understand, work with, and professionally critique computational project requirements and outcomes
Encounter the problems inherent with medium-to-large-scale IT projects and understand how to apply project management principles to work past them
Be able to analyze the legal, ethical, and societal ramifications of professional work in computer science
